greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of n-node unlabeled rooted trees with thickening limbs and root outdegree (branching factor) k; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 0<=k<=n-1, read by rows.
comment: In a rooted tree with thickening limbs the outdegree of a parent node is smaller than or equal to the outdegree of any of its non-leaf child nodes.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
example: The A245152(5) = 5 5-node rooted trees with thickening limbs sorted by root outdegree are:
: o   o     o   :   o   o : o o o o :
: o   o   o o o : o   o   :         :
maple: b:= proc(n, i, h, v) option remember; `if`(n=0,
mathematica: b[n_, i_, h_, v_] := b[n, i, h, v] = If[n == 0, If[v == 0, 1, 0], If[i<1 || v<1 || n<v, 0, If[n == v, 1, Sum[Binomial[A[i, h] + j - 1, j]*b[n - i*j, i-1, h, v-j], {j, 0, Min[n/i, v]}]]]]; A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = If[n<2, n, Sum[b[n-1, n-1, j, j], {j, k, n-1}]]; T[n_, k_] := b[n-1, n-1, k, k]; Table[ Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n - 1}], {n, 1, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 27 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 12 2014
